intro: Galium fagetorum, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the montane regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium fagetorum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
